title: Keilar rolls the tape on Republican's incendiary rhetoric of the border crisis
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar rolls the tape on the GOP's rhetoric of how the Biden administration is handling the border crisis.

title: $180,000 reward, billboard campaign part of effort to solve shootings of 3 kids
description: Minnesota officials are offering a reward of up to $180,000 for information that solves the shootings of three children.

title: Dr. Wen's checklist for sending her child back to school
description: Are these Covid-19 safety precautions part of your child's back-to-school plan?

title: Greece faces 'disaster of unprecedented proportions' as wildfires ravage the country
description: Greece is facing a "natural disaster of unprecedented proportions," as 586 wildfires burn in "all corners" of the country, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said in a televised address on Monday.

title: Things look grim in Afghanistan, even with US airpower. In 22 days, they could be much worse
description: Many thought it would happen like this. But to see it so fast, so stark, brings no comfort in the prediction. The last five days have brought Afghanistan to arguably the most perilous place in the last two decades.

title: Footage shows lush natural paradise turn into desert
description: One of the world's largest salt lakes is evaporating at an alarming pace and threatening the livelihoods of those who live nearby.  CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Elephant herd that captivated world is heading home
description: A herd of elephants in China is making its way home after traveling more than 500 kilometers last year.

title: This terrifying 'dragon" was Australia's largest flying reptile
description: There was once a species of terrifying "dragon" flying over Australia 105 million years ago, according to new research. The fossil of a pterosaur with a nearly 30-foot (7-meter) wingspan once belonged to Australia's largest flying reptile.

title: Greta Thunberg revealed as Vogue Scandinavia's inaugural cover star
description: Teenage climate activist Greta Thunberg has been unveiled as the cover star of Vogue Scandinavia's first issue. Shot by Swedish photography and conservationist duo Alexandrov Klum, the whimsical cover shows Thunberg wearing a billowing upcycled trench coat while sitting with an Icelandic horse called Gandalf in a woodland outside of Stockholm.

title: Venus gets 'unprecedented' double flyby this week
description: Venus gets back-to-back visitors this week, with the flybys of two European Space Agency-backed spacecraft.

title: 'I didn't think that I was just going to be killed': Ocasio-Cortez on her fears on January 6
description: When Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was barricaded inside her office during the Capitol insurrection on January 6, she not only feared that mob would kill her, but that she would be raped if the rioters found her.

title: Biden issues executive order targeting Belarusian regime
description: President Joe Biden issued a sweeping executive order Monday to target those in the Belarusian regime involved in the repression of human rights and democracy in the former Soviet state.

title: Barbie condemned after releasing 'inclusive' Tokyo Olympics collection
description: America's most popular fashion doll Barbie has received widespread criticism on social media for not featuring an Asian Barbie in their collection dedicated to the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games.

title: Covid cases are rising in countries praised for stopping outbreaks. Do they need to change their strategies?
Norwegian Cruise Line can require proof of Covid-19 vaccination in Florida, federal judge rules
description: Norwegian Cruise Line can require proof of Covid-19 vaccination for passengers and crew members, a federal judge ruled Sunday, after the cruise line operator had challenged Florida's ban on vaccine passports.

title: New revelations expose future threat Trump poses
London's Tower Bridge is stuck open due to a technical fault
description: A technical fault has left world-famous London landmark Tower Bridge stuck open on Monday afternoon, with cars and pedestrians unable to cross.

title: Harrison Ford spotted in rare appearance with wife Calista Flockhart
description: Harrison Ford and his wife of ten years, actress Calista Flockhart, were photographed this past weekend during an outing in Croatia.

title: How pandemic financial stress impacts mental health, and what we can do about it
description: Since coronavirus shuttered the world in the early months of 2020, the financial impact has taken a significant -- and often invisible -- toll.

title: Kathy Griffin provides update after cancer surgery
description: Comedian Kathy Griffin provided a video update on Instagram after a surgical procedure following her lung cancer diangosis.

title: One of the world's biggest cigarette makers wants to buy an asthma inhaler company
description: A UK company that makes products to treat lung conditions could wind up in the hands of one of the world's biggest cigarette makers, prompting an outcry from health charities that are calling on the British government to block the deal.

title: Domino's is giving away $50 million of free food to take on DoorDash
description: Domino's Pizza is taking on delivery apps that charge extra fees with a new giveaway totaling $50 million worth of free food.

title: Limp Bizkit cancels tour dates because of Covid-19 concerns
description: Limp Bizkit have canceled their remaining August tour dates due to concerns regarding Covid-19 cases.

title: Reba McEntire warns fans after she and her boyfriend contracted breakthrough Covid-19
description: Reba McEntire is telling people to continue to mask up and quarantine.

title: As the Tokyo Olympics ends, all eyes are now on the Beijing Winter Games
description: With the Olympic flame extinguished in Tokyo, all eyes are now on Beijing for the 2022 Winter Games less than six months away.

title: Startling video shows friends trapped in elevator as floodwaters pour in
description: Tony Luu speaks with CNN after dramatic video showed him and a friend trapped in an elevator in Omaha, Nebraska, as flood waters rushed in.

title: Jon Stewart and Pete Davidson mark 20th anniversary of 9/11 with star-studded comedy event
description: Jon Stewart and Pete Davidson are gathering some of comedy's biggest names in remembrance of the 20th anniversary of 9/11.

title: Pfizer vaccine may receive full FDA approval soon, and the ramifications could alter course of pandemic
description: Pfizer's Covid-19 vaccine is currently only authorized for emergency use in the United States, but its full approval by the US Food and Drug Administration could happen within weeks.

title: Warren Buffett is buying more of his own stock as Berkshire profits surge
description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, like the rest of Corporate America, had a miserable first half of 2020 due to the Covid-19 pandemic. But as the stock market and economy has rebounded, so have the fortunes of the Oracle of Omaha's massive conglomerate.

title: Paris 2024 takes up Olympic baton as organizers say 'we'll be able to breathe'
description: Perched beside the river Seine, in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower, Paris' Trocadéro gardens are no stranger to crowds.

title: Samsung's jailed leader Lee Jae-yong to be released on parole
description: Samsung's vice chairman — and de facto leader — Lee Jae-yong is to be released on parole this week, South Korea's Justice Ministry said on Monday.

title: Big moves for oil, gold and bonds after blockbuster US jobs report
description: The US jobs report for July was really good.

title: This company uses space-age tech to cut your air conditioning bill
description: SkyCool Systems uses passive, electricity free cooling panels made with proprietary materials to make refrigeration and air conditioning more efficient.

title: At R. Kelly's trial, jurors will be the only members of the public allowed in the courtroom
description: Jury selection for singer R. Kelly's trial begins Monday, with hundreds of potential jurors expected to appear in federal court in Brooklyn, New York, as Covid-19 cases surge, fueled by the Delta variant.

title: Jane Withers, child star of Hollywood's Golden Age, dies aged 95
description: Jane Withers, a former child movie star who won hearts during Hollywood's Golden Age, has died aged 95.

title: How this homeless artist became a viral internet sensation
description: Life for Richard Hutchins hasn't been easy. Originally from Atlanta, Georgia, he grew up in Techwood Homes, one of the first federal public housing projects in the United States, before moving to Los Angeles.

title: UN condemns Zimbabwe child marriages as girl dies after giving birth
description: The United Nations has condemned the practice of child marriage in Zimbabwe following the death of a 14-year-old girl after she gave birth at a church shrine, an incident that caused outrage among citizens and rights activists.

title: Golfer Kim Si Woo finds water five times on one hole to set unwanted landmark PGA Tour score
description: Sometimes, as a golfer, even though you're trying your hardest, you can feel your round slipping away.

title: Cases rise in countries praised for stopping outbreaks. Do they need to change strategies?
description: A year and a half since the first Covid-19 cases were identified, many countries in Asia-Pacific feel right back where they started.

title: Singapore Changi Airport falls from top spot as world's best airports for 2021 revealed
description: For the first time in nearly a decade, Singapore's Changi Airport has lost its place at the top of Skytrax's annual ranking of the world's best airports at the World Airport Awards.

title: From Simone Biles to skateboarding, these are the notable moments of the Tokyo Olympics
description: When history looks back on this year's Tokyo Olympics, images of masked athletes and empty stadiums will likely be the defining feature. But look beyond the Covid-19 protocols and it will be clear this was a Games with more than one story to tell.
